question_sentence: Andrew Cuomo, 63, is retiring. How much pension is he expected to receive each year for his 15 years of state service?
Disney announced that its theme parks are dropping:
Which Republican governor, who has opposed vaccine and mask mandates, tested positive for COVID-19 on Tuesday?
Whose decision was it to withdraw U.S. troops out of Afghanistan?
A man is suing a Nevada condominium over injuries he sustained after:
choices: A tumbleweed hit him while sunbathing
Being startled by a bear in a dumpster

question_sentence: Which of these toy shops is making a comeback, with the help of Macy’s?
Arizona Diamondbacks pitcher Tyler Gilbert threw a no-hitter this week. How many have been thrown in MLB this season?
The Biden administration said nursing homes must vaccinate employees if they want to continue:
Polish javelin thrower Maria Andrejczyk auctioned off her medal from the Tokyo Olympics to help fund which of these things?
choices: A life-saving heart surgery for an infant

question_sentence: The travel mask mandate that will be extended into January includes all of the following except:
Mini ‘brains’ grown in a lab by scientists have started to develop which organs?
evidence: Scientist said ‘optic cups’ formed on the brain tissue

question_sentence: Foreign Secretary Dominic Raab was reportedly ‘lounging’ on the beach on which Mediterranean island as Kabul fell?
evidence: Some early reports said Cyprus, but Raab was in fact in a five-star resort in Crete

question_sentence: How many domestic new cases of Covid triggered a new lockdown in New Zealand this week?
evidence: Auckland will be locked down for a week and the rest of the country for three days

question_sentence: Model Lily Cole apologised after posing wearing what during an Instagram photoshoot?
evidence: She was accused of ‘spitting in the face of Afghan women’ after posting the photo, captioned #diversity

question_sentence: Who called on the Garrick Club this week to begin admitting women and described how she was made to stand outside while her husband was allowed in?
evidence: Blair joined 300 lawyers who signed a petition demanding that women should be admitted

question_sentence: Which world leader this week staked their future on their Covid performance by calling an early general election?
evidence: Trudeau called a general election in Canada, where 26,000 people have died of Covid and 65% of the population has been vaccinated

question_sentence: Which tennis star fuelling speculation about his retirement by withdrawing from the US Open?
evidence: Federer said he needed surgery on an injured knee

question_sentence: Which airport was judged to be the world’s best at this week’s Skytrax awards?
evidence: The top-ranked UK airport was London Heathrow

question_sentence: What is the official mascot of the Tokyo 2020 Paralympic Games?
evidence: Someity is said to ‘embody Paralympic athletes that demonstrate superhuman power’

question_sentence: Which animals are captivating China as they head back to their nature reserve after wandering hundreds of miles across the country?
evidence: We discuss the elephants’ incredible journey on The Week Unwrapped podcast this week

question_sentence: Which country went into full lockdown over the discovery of a single, locally transmitted case of Covid-19 in the country – the first of its kind since February?
evidence: The case, discovered in a 58-year-old unvaccinated man from Aukland, was New Zealand’s first locally transmitted case of Covid-19 since February. More positive cases have since arisen.

question_sentence: What is the largest water reservoir in the United States by volume? This reservoir is now at dangerously low levels due to climate change-induced drought.
evidence: Lake Mead, located in Arizona and Nevada, is the largest reservoir in the US by volume. It is dealing with historic lows as the Colorado River, its main tributary, is experiencing a federally declared water shortage for the first time ever.

question_sentence: Which telecommunications company is one of the latest entities to suffer a data breach, potentially affecting tens of millions of customers?
evidence: T-Mobile confirmed that it had been breached by a cyber-attack, compromising the personal information of tens of millions of current, past and prospective customers, according to the company.

question_sentence: The Taliban has taken swift control of Afghanistan, including the capital city of Kabul, following the withdrawal of US troops. When was the last time the Islamist group held control of the country?
evidence: Gaining control of Afghanistan in 1996, the Taliban was forced out of power in 2001 following the US-led invasion of the country.

question_sentence: Prime Minister Narendra Modi of India has announced a plan to spend over $1 trillion dollars on infrastructure and the creation of hundreds of thousands of jobs. He is calling the plan “Gati Shakti.” What does that Hindi phrase mean?
evidence: Modi announced the 100-trillion rupee ($1.35 trillion) plan on the country’s 75th Independence Day, calling it “Gati Shakti,” which means momentum.

question_sentence: With the sudden takeover by the Taliban, the US is scrambling to bring Americans, respective allies and Afghan partners safely out of Afghanistan. According to President Joe Biden, by what date is the US hoping to get all of its citizens out of the country?
evidence: Biden said Americans should expect for all US citizens in Afghanistan to be evacuated by August 31 – the original deadline set for ending the nation’s longest war – but stopped short of saying all troops would be out by that time.

question_sentence: Actress Debra Winger revealed that she dropped out of an iconic 1992 film because Madonna was added to the cast. What was the film?
evidence: Saying that the addition turned the production into “an Elvis film,” Winger removed herself from the cast of the classic film “A League of Their Own,” and was ultimately replaced by Geena Davis.

question_sentence: Which private space company is suing NASA over its plans for the “Human Landing System,” its latest lunar landing endeavor?
evidence: After NASA initially pledged to offer multiple contracts to spur the development of at least two lunar landers, Blue Origin – owned by multibillionaire Jeff Bezos – filed a federal lawsuit over the agency’s exclusive contract of the HLS project to SpaceX for $2.9 billion in April.

question_sentence: Gov. Greg Abbott tested positive for coronavirus this week. What state does he lead?
evidence: Greg Abbott, a Republican, is the governor of Texas. His positive test result follows his attendance of an indoor “Republican Club” event. Abbott has opposed mask mandates, and issued of an executive order banning school districts from requiring masks and other Covid-19 restrictions.

question_sentence: Which NFL team released Tim Tebow from their ranks after his brief, experimental stint as a tight end?
evidence: Tebow, the star quarterback-turned-baseball player-turned-tight end, was released from the Jacksonville Jaguars. The Jaguars are led by Urban Meyer, Tebow’s former coach at the University of Florida.
